meanings.definition: To cease thinking about or consider
meanings.sent1: After a long day, I just want to unthink all my worries and relax.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes it's nice to unthink all the stress and just enjoy the moment.
meanings.sent3: I tried to unthink my homework, but it kept popping back into my head.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright that it made me unthink all my troubles.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful music helped me unthink the chaos of the day.

meanings.definition: To reverse or undo a previous thought or decision
meanings.sent1: I had to unthink my choice and go with the other option instead.
meanings.sent2: It's hard to unthink a decision once it's been made.
meanings.sent3: He tried to unthink his order at the restaurant, but it was already being prepared.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to unthink the card trick right before our eyes.
meanings.sent5: Her apology made me unthink my anger and forgive her instantly.
